title: [Large-scale] E-learning Effectiveness Design Strategies Based on Sociotechnical Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Entry-level domain knowledge in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Science education program for professional learners, featuring smartphone-based learning environments and summative assessment-driven operations.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the four components of the Leavitt Model (task, structure, actor, technology) and apply them to e-learning system design.
Learners can develop tools to assess the interaction between technological systems (content/platforms) and social systems (learner interactions/organizational structures).
Learners can establish mobile-optimized strategies that ensure effective learning in constrained technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
